“Rodion Romanovitch, don’t shout,” Porfiry said calmly.  
“You’re lying! Call the clerks!” Raskolnikov shouted.  
“You wanted to drive me to fury!”  
Porfiry smiled, “What are you waiting for? Produce your facts.”  
“Why deputies? What will people imagine?”  
“Produce them! I’m ready!” Raskolnikov demanded.  
Suddenly, a noise came from the door.  
Both men paused, surprised.  
Something unexpected was about to happen.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov confronts Porfiry, accusing him of manipulation and demanding evidence against him, leading to an unexpected turn in their tense exchange.
